results.question: Why do some states have more representatives than other states?
incorrect_answers: Because they are the original colonies.
Because of the size of the state.

results.question: What does the constitution do?
incorrect_answers: Protect the basic rights of Americans.

Secretary of Housing and Urban Development

results.question: What does the judicial branch do?
incorrect_answers: Decides if a law goes against the constitution.

results.question: What is the highest court in the United States?

incorrect_answers: You don’t have to pay (a poll tax) to vote.
Any citizen can vote. (Women and men can vote.)
A male citizen of any race (can vote).

results.question: What are the responsibilities that is only for United States citizens?
results.correct_answer: Serve on a jury and vote in federal election.
incorrect_answers: Join to a political party and help with a campaign.
Give an elected official your opinion on an issue and write a newspaper.
Run for office and join to a community group.

results.question: Name the right only for United States citizens.
results.correct_answer: Vote in federal elections and run for federal office.
incorrect_answers: Join to a political party and help with a campaign.
Give an elected official your opinion on an issue and write a newspaper.
Run for office and join to a community group.

results.question: What are the rights of everyone living in the United States?
What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?
incorrect_answers: The president of the United States.

results.question: What is one promise you make when you become a United States citizen?
incorrect_answers: Give up loyalty to other countries.
Defend the Constitution and laws of the United States.
Obey the laws of the United States.
Serve in the U.S. military (if needed).
Serve (do important work for) the nation (if needed).
Be loyal to the United States.

results.question: How old do citizens have to be to vote for President?
What are the ways that Americans can participate in their democracy?
incorrect_answers: Give an elected official your opinion on an issue.
Publicly support or oppose an issue or policy

funded_year.overview: Wetpaint is a technology platform company that uses its proprietary state-of-the-art technology and expertise in social media to build and monetize audiences for digital publishers. Wetpaint’s own online property, Wetpaint Entertainment, an entertainment news site that attracts more than 12 million unique visitors monthly and has over 2 million Facebook fans, is a proof point to the company’s success in building and engaging audiences. Media companies can license Wetpaint’s platform which includes a dynamic playbook tailored to their individual needs and comprehensive training. Founded by Internet pioneer Ben Elowitz, and with offices in New York and Seattle, Wetpaint is backed by Accel Partners, the investors behind Facebook.
